name: reconcentration
content:
reconcentration noun [U]
(BRINGING TOGETHER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of bringing something together again in a large number or amount in one particular area: A declaration of emergency entails a reconcentration of power in the hands of the executive. This reduction in funding to the project will lead to a re-concentration of the poor in certain areas.
More examplesFewer examplesFlying insects in the tropics are exposed to the possibility of re-concentration by wind convergence.Their chief response to defeat was the reorganization and reconcentration of their commercial, agricultural, and military interests in the remaining overseas dominions. This concentration, then dispersal, then reconcentration of population in urban centres had a significant effect on housing.

reconcentration noun [U]
(MAKING STRONGER)
the action of making a liquid or substance stronger and reducing its size again, by removing water from it: Some of the processes lead to progressive dilution, others to physical or biological reconcentration. He was involved in laboratory studies on the reconcentration of fission products and plutonium in sediments, seaweed and fish.
More examplesFewer examplesThe solution can be rediluted with water to 2 ml before reconcentration.A higher temperature means greater re-concentration of the solution.
